item.title: Zahida add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Epicurus
item.description: "Death, therefore, the most awful of evils, is nothing to us, seeing that, when we are, death is not come, and, when death is come, we are not." -- Epicurus

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Plutarch
item.description: "The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled." -- Plutarch

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "When you don't have anything, then you have everything." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "The person who gives with a smile is the best giver because God loves a cheerful giver." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Gautama Buddha
item.description: "All that we are is the result of what we have thought: it is founded on our thoughts and made up of our thoughts. If a man speak or act with an evil thought, suffering follows him as the wheel follows the hoof of the beast that draws the wagon.... If a man speak or act with a good thought, happiness follows him like a shadow that never leaves him." -- Gautama Buddha

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Mary Astell
item.description: "If all men are born free, how is it that all women are born slaves?" -- Mary Astell

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Shirley Chisholm
item.description: "The emotional, sexual, and psychological stereotyping of females begins when the doctor says: "It's a girl." -- Shirley Chisholm

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "a women is like a tea bag.it's only when she is in hot water that you realize how strong she is." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Lois Wyse
item.description: "Men are taught to apologize for their weaknesses, women for their strengths." -- Lois Wyse

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Lois Wyse
item.description: "Don't worry whether or not I am now happy. Today is only chapter one, we have yet to write a book." -- Lois Wyse

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Rabbi Sofer
item.description: "No woman is required to build the world by destroying herself." -- Rabbi Sofer

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Brigham Young
item.description: "You educate a man; you educate a man. You educate a woman; you educate a generation." -- Brigham Young

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Zahida add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Here's all you have to know about men and women: women are crazy, men are stupid. And the main reason women are crazy is that men are stupid." -- George Carlin

item.title: Zahida add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "How wrong is it for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself?" -- Anais Nin
